text: René Metge (23 October 1941 - 3 January 2024) was a professional rally driver from France. He won the Dakar Rally three times (in 1981, 1984 and 1986). He was born in Montrouge, France. == Career == Metge started his career in international motor racing in the Formula Renault 2.0 West European Cup in 1973. He got 28 points in the general classification there. In later years, Metge also appeared in the French Supertouring Championship, FIA World Endurance Championship, World Sportscar Championship, World Touring Car Championship, Porsche 944 Turbo Cup France, 24 Hours of Le Mans and European Touring Car Championship. ==Death== Metge died on 3 January 2024 at the age of 82.Le pilote automobile René Metge, triple vainqueur du Dakar, est mort == Bibliography == * René Metge == References == Category:1941 births Category:French racecar drivers Category:24 Hours of Le Mans drivers Category:Sportspeople from Hauts-de-Seine Category:2024 deaths
title: René Metge
